description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

TestScript.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

url.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this test script when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this test script is (or will be) published. The URL SHOULD include the major version of the test script. For more information see [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).

identifier.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this test script when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

version.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the test script when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the test script author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

name.description: A natural language name identifying the test script. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

title.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the test script.

status.description: The status of this test script. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

experimental.description: A boolean value to indicate that this test script is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

date.description: The date  (and optionally time) when the test script was published. The date must change if and when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the test script changes.

publisher.description: The name of the individual or organization that published the test script.

contact.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

description.description: A free text natural language description of the test script from a consumer's perspective.

useContext.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate test script instances.

jurisdiction.description: A legal or geographic region in which the test script is intended to be used.

purpose.description: Explaination of why this test script is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

copyright.description: A copyright statement relating to the test script and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the test script.

origin.description: An abstract server used in operations within this test script in the origin element.

destination.description: An abstract server used in operations within this test script in the destination element.

metadata.description: The required capability must exist and are assumed to function correctly on the FHIR server being tested.

fixture.description: Fixture in the test script - by reference (uri). All fixtures are required for the test script to execute.

profile.description: Reference to the profile to be used for validation.

variable.description: Variable is set based either on element value in response body or on header field value in the response headers.

rule.description: Assert rule to be used in one or more asserts within the test script.

ruleset.description: Contains one or more rules.  Offers a way to group rules so assertions could reference the group of rules and have them all applied.

setup.description: A series of required setup operations before tests are executed.

teardown.description: A series of operations required to clean up after the all the tests are executed (successfully or otherwise).

TestScript_Origin.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

index.description: Abstract name given to an origin server in this test script.  The name is provided as a number starting at 1.

profile.description: The type of origin profile the test system supports.

TestScript_Destination.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

index.description: Abstract name given to a destination server in this test script.  The name is provided as a number starting at 1.

profile.description: The type of destination profile the test system supports.

TestScript_Metadata.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

link.description: A link to the FHIR specification that this test is covering.

capability.description: Capabilities that must exist and are assumed to function correctly on the FHIR server being tested.

TestScript_Link.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

url.description: URL to a particular requirement or feature within the FHIR specification.

TestScript_Capability.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

required.description: Whether or not the test execution will require the given capabilities of the server in order for this test script to execute.

validated.description: Whether or not the test execution will validate the given capabilities of the server in order for this test script to execute.

description.description: Description of the capabilities that this test script is requiring the server to support.

origin.description: Which origin server these requirements apply to.

destination.description: Which server these requirements apply to.

link.description: Links to the FHIR specification that describes this interaction and the resources involved in more detail.

capabilities.description: Minimum capabilities required of server for test script to execute successfully.   If server does not meet at a minimum the referenced capability statement, then all tests in this script are skipped.

TestScript_Fixture.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

autocreate.description: Whether or not to implicitly create the fixture during setup. If true, the fixture is automatically created on each server being tested during setup, therefore no create operation is required for this fixture in the TestScript.setup section.

autodelete.description: Whether or not to implicitly delete the fixture during teardown. If true, the fixture is automatically deleted on each server being tested during teardown, therefore no delete operation is required for this fixture in the TestScript.teardown section.

resource.description: Reference to the resource (containing the contents of the resource needed for operations).

TestScript_Variable.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

defaultValue.description: A default, hard-coded, or user-defined value for this variable.

description.description: A free text natural language description of the variable and its purpose.

expression.description: The fluentpath expression to evaluate against the fixture body. When variables are defined, only one of either expression, headerField or path must be specified.

headerField.description: Will be used to grab the HTTP header field value from the headers that sourceId is pointing to.

hint.description: Displayable text string with hint help information to the user when entering a default value.

path.description: XPath or JSONPath to evaluate against the fixture body.  When variables are defined, only one of either expression, headerField or path must be specified.

sourceId.description: Fixture to evaluate the XPath/JSONPath expression or the headerField  against within this variable.

TestScript_Rule.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

resource.description: Reference to the resource (containing the contents of the rule needed for assertions).

param.description: Each rule template can take one or more parameters for rule evaluation.

TestScript_Param.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

name.description: Descriptive name for this parameter that matches the external assert rule parameter name.

value.description: The explicit or dynamic value for the parameter that will be passed on to the external rule template.

TestScript_Ruleset.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

resource.description: Reference to the resource (containing the contents of the ruleset needed for assertions).

rule.description: The referenced rule within the external ruleset template.

TestScript_Rule1.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

ruleId.description: Id of the referenced rule within the external ruleset template.

param.description: Each rule template can take one or more parameters for rule evaluation.

TestScript_Param1.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

name.description: Descriptive name for this parameter that matches the external assert ruleset rule parameter name.

value.description: The value for the parameter that will be passed on to the external ruleset rule template.

TestScript_Setup.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

action.description: Action would contain either an operation or an assertion.

TestScript_Action.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

assert.description: Evaluates the results of previous operations to determine if the server under test behaves appropriately.

TestScript_Operation.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

resource.description: The type of the resource.  See http://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/resourcelist.html.

label.description: The label would be used for tracking/logging purposes by test engines.

description.description: The description would be used by test engines for tracking and reporting purposes.

accept.description: The content-type or mime-type to use for RESTful operation in the 'Accept' header.

contentType.description: The content-type or mime-type to use for RESTful operation in the 'Content-Type' header.

destination.description: The server where the request message is destined for.  Must be one of the server numbers listed in TestScript.destination section.

encodeRequestUrl.description: Whether or not to implicitly send the request url in encoded format. The default is true to match the standard RESTful client behavior. Set to false when communicating with a server that does not support encoded url paths.

origin.description: The server where the request message originates from.  Must be one of the server numbers listed in TestScript.origin section.

params.description: Path plus parameters after [type].  Used to set parts of the request URL explicitly.

requestHeader.description: Header elements would be used to set HTTP headers.

requestId.description: The fixture id (maybe new) to map to the request.

responseId.description: The fixture id (maybe new) to map to the response.

sourceId.description: The id of the fixture used as the body of a PUT or POST request.

targetId.description: Id of fixture used for extracting the [id],  [type], and [vid] for GET requests.

TestScript_RequestHeader.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

value.description: The value of the header e.g. "application/fhir+xml".

TestScript_Assert.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

label.description: The label would be used for tracking/logging purposes by test engines.

description.description: The description would be used by test engines for tracking and reporting purposes.

direction.description: The direction to use for the assertion.

compareToSourceId.description: Id of the source fixture used as the contents to be evaluated by either the "source/expression" or "sourceId/path" definition.

compareToSourceExpression.description: The fluentpath expression to evaluate against the source fixture. When compareToSourceId is defined, either compareToSourceExpression or compareToSourcePath must be defined, but not both.

compareToSourcePath.description: XPath or JSONPath expression to evaluate against the source fixture. When compareToSourceId is defined, either compareToSourceExpression or compareToSourcePath must be defined, but not both.

contentType.description: The content-type or mime-type to use for RESTful operation in the 'Content-Type' header.

expression.description: The fluentpath expression to be evaluated against the request or response message contents - HTTP headers and payload.

headerField.description: The HTTP header field name e.g. 'Location'.

minimumId.description: The ID of a fixture.  Asserts that the response contains at a minimum the fixture specified by minimumId.

navigationLinks.description: Whether or not the test execution performs validation on the bundle navigation links.

operator.description: The operator type defines the conditional behavior of the assert. If not defined, the default is equals.

path.description: The XPath or JSONPath expression to be evaluated against the fixture representing the response received from server.

requestMethod.description: The request method or HTTP operation code to compare against that used by the client system under test.

requestURL.description: The value to use in a comparison against the request URL path string.

resource.description: The type of the resource.  See http://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/resourcelist.html.

response.description: okay | created | noContent | notModified | bad | forbidden | notFound | methodNotAllowed | conflict | gone | preconditionFailed | unprocessable.

responseCode.description: The value of the HTTP response code to be tested.

rule.description: The TestScript.rule this assert will evaluate.

ruleset.description: The TestScript.ruleset this assert will evaluate.

sourceId.description: Fixture to evaluate the XPath/JSONPath expression or the headerField  against.

validateProfileId.description: The ID of the Profile to validate against.

warningOnly.description: Whether or not the test execution will produce a warning only on error for this assert.

TestScript_Rule2.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

ruleId.description: The TestScript.rule id value this assert will evaluate.

param.description: Each rule template can take one or more parameters for rule evaluation.

TestScript_Param2.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

name.description: Descriptive name for this parameter that matches the external assert rule parameter name.

value.description: The value for the parameter that will be passed on to the external rule template.

TestScript_Ruleset1.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

rulesetId.description: The TestScript.ruleset id value this assert will evaluate.

rule.description: The referenced rule within the external ruleset template.

TestScript_Rule3.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

ruleId.description: Id of the referenced rule within the external ruleset template.

param.description: Each rule template can take one or more parameters for rule evaluation.

TestScript_Param3.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

name.description: Descriptive name for this parameter that matches the external assert ruleset rule parameter name.

value.description: The value for the parameter that will be passed on to the external ruleset rule template.

TestScript_Test.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

name.description: The name of this test used for tracking/logging purposes by test engines.

description.description: A short description of the test used by test engines for tracking and reporting purposes.

action.description: Action would contain either an operation or an assertion.

TestScript_Action1.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

operation.description: An operation would involve a REST request to a server.

assert.description: Evaluates the results of previous operations to determine if the server under test behaves appropriately.

TestScript_Teardown.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

action.description: The teardown action will only contain an operation.

TestScript_Action2.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

operation.description: An operation would involve a REST request to a server.

Identifier.description: A technical identifier - identifies some entity uniquely and unambiguously.

type.description: A coded type for the identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

system.description: Establishes the namespace for the value - that is, a URL that describes a set values that are unique.

value.description: The portion of the identifier typically relevant to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.

period.description: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

ContactDetail.description: Specifies contact information for a person or organization.

name.description: The name of an individual to contact.

telecom.description: The contact details for the individual (if a name was provided) or the organization.

UsageContext.description: Specifies clinical/business/etc metadata that can be used to retrieve, index and/or categorize an artifact. This metadata can either be specific to the applicable population (e.g., age category, DRG) or the specific context of care (e.g., venue, care setting, provider of care).

code.description: A code that identifies the type of context being specified by this usage context.

valueCodeableConcept.description: A value that defines the context specified in this context of use. The interpretation of the value is defined by the code.

valueQuantity.description: A value that defines the context specified in this context of use. The interpretation of the value is defined by the code.

valueRange.description: A value that defines the context specified in this context of use. The interpretation of the value is defined by the code.

CodeableConcept.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

Reference.description: A reference from one resource to another.

reference.description: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.

identifier.description: An identifier for the other resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.

display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

Coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

system.description: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

version.description: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured. and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.

code.description: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).

display.description: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

userSelected.description: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - i.e. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).

Period.description: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.

end.description: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.

ContactPoint.description: Details for all kinds of technology mediated contact points for a person or organization, including telephone, email, etc.

system.description: Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.

value.description: The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).

use.description: Identifies the purpose for the contact point.

rank.description: Specifies a preferred order in which to use a set of contacts. Contacts are ranked with lower values coming before higher values.

period.description: Time period when the contact point was/is in use.

Quantity.description: A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.

value.description: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.

comparator.description: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

unit.description: A human-readable form of the unit.

system.description: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.

code.description: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.

Range.description: A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.

low.description: The low limit. The boundary is inclusive.

high.description: The high limit. The boundary is inclusive.
